intro: Buena stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit boa, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its fruit is a capsule that remains closed until mature, releasing seeds through a unique mechanism. Buena stenocarpa is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it an important species in its ecosystem.
